page.title: 06Gingko House Farm,Paulton.
page.content: { Gingko House Farm}covers 40 acres. There are 7 fields.The farmer keeps 28 dairy cattle.Each cow gives about 3500 litres of milk a year.Grass and kale are grown for cattle feed. The farmer grows vegetables and bedding plants for sale.He keeps 50 chickens and a goat.He and his wife and son do all the work on the farm. The farm is on the site of Radford Pit.The farmhouse was originally the pit_ponies'stables.The house is about 200 years old The farmer works long hours and never takes a holiday. The farm is named after a Gingko tree which grows near the house.It was planted by the farmer's mother about 80 years ago. The farmer owns hay_making machinery and a tractor.
